definition: to hang or suspend/to worry/public announcement/unresolved/baseless/without foundation
to bestow (a reward)/to give (to an inferior)/to hand down/a reward (bestowed by a superior)/to appreciate (beauty)
an order to post a reward (for the capture of a criminal)

sentences.english: Will you buy ads, encourage referrals from existing customers, create a website?
sentences.chinese: 你要買廣告，懸賞已有客戶的推薦，製作網頁嗎？

sentences.english: I feel good when I am drunk, because I can tell you what I think in my heart.
sentences.chinese: 懸賞醉了的感覺真好，能對你說心裏話。漢譯英？

sentences.english: Every member of the gang has a price on his head.
sentences.chinese: 這幫歹徒每個人都被懸賞通輯。

sentences.english: It's good to be drunk, so that I can talk to you with my heart.
sentences.chinese: 懸賞醉了的感覺真好，能對你說心裏話。漢譯英？

sentences.english: Authorities put a $5 million bounty on his head.
sentences.chinese: 官方懸賞5百萬美金買萬利拉的頭。

sentences.english: Current, this sends Cong Mou of bloodguilty of post offer a reward to already was detained by public security on the net.
sentences.chinese: 目前，這位在網上發帖懸賞殺人的叢某已被治安拘留。

sentences.english: I didnt say there was a reward. I dont have $2000 dollars.
sentences.chinese: 我可沒說要懸賞阿，我哪來2000元啊。

sentences.english: Residents have been offered cash rewards for any tips that lead to an arrest.
sentences.chinese: 當局還懸賞向提供嫌犯線索的居民頒發現金獎勵。

sentences.english: He was driven back to pao an with a price on his head .
sentences.chinese: 在懸賞緝拿他的首級的情況下他被迫退到保安去。

definition: to steal (including identity theft, credit card fraud or theft of computer account)/to misappropriate
to use gain as a lure
to take back (forcibly)/to recapture/to win back
